entity1.name: Clouds
entity1.description: A visible mass of condensed water vapor floating in the atmosphere, typically high above the ground.

entity2.name: Sky
entity2.description: The atmosphere and outer space as viewed from Earth, appearing as a vast expanse overhead.

entity3.name: temperature
entity3.description: A measure of the average kinetic energy of particles in a substance.

entity4.name: humidity
entity4.description: The amount of water vapor present in the air.

entity5.name: air currents
entity5.description: Movements of air within the atmosphere, often caused by differences in temperature and pressure.

entity6.name: clouds
entity6.description: Visible masses of water droplets or frozen crystals suspended in the atmosphere, typically visible as white or gray aggregates.

entity7.name: Cloud formation
entity7.description: The process by which clouds are created in the atmosphere.

entity8.name: Earth's surface
entity8.description: The outer layer of the Earth, including land and water surfaces.

entity9.name: Sun
entity9.description: The star at the center of the solar system that provides light and energy to Earth.

entity10.name: sun
entity10.description: The star at the center of the solar system, providing light and energy to Earth.

entity11.name: ground
entity11.description: The surface of the earth, including soil, rock, and other materials.

entity12.name: dew point
entity12.description: The temperature at which air becomes saturated with water vapor, causing condensation to occur.

entity13.name: water vapor
entity13.description: A gaseous form of water that is present in the atmosphere and plays a significant role in weather and climate processes.

entity14.name: dew point
entity14.description: The temperature at which water vapor in the air begins to condense into liquid water or ice.

entity15.name: water vapor
entity15.description: Water in its gaseous state, present in the atmosphere and contributing to weather phenomena.

entity16.name: condense
entity16.description: The process by which a substance changes from a gas into a liquid or solid, often due to cooling or increased pressure.

entity17.name: water droplets
entity17.description: Small drops of water that form when water vapor condenses in the atmosphere or on surfaces.

entity18.name: ice crystals
entity18.description: Solid forms of water with a crystalline structure, often formed by the freezing of water droplets in cold conditions.

entity19.name: droplets
entity19.description: Small drops of liquid, typically water, that form in the atmosphere and contribute to cloud formation.

entity20.name: crystals
entity20.description: Solid structures with a regular geometric arrangement of atoms or molecules, often forming in cold atmospheric conditions and contributing to cloud formation.

entity21.name: clouds
entity21.description: Visible masses of water droplets or ice crystals suspended in the atmosphere above the surface of a planetary body, typically Earth.

entity22.name: condensation
entity22.description: A process in which water vapor changes into liquid form, contributing to cloud formation.

entity23.name: cloud formation
entity23.description: The process by which clouds are created through the condensation of water vapor in the atmosphere.

entity24.name: water vapor
entity24.description: Water in its gaseous state, present in the Earth's atmosphere and a key component in cloud formation.

entity25.name: temperature
entity25.description: A measure of the average kinetic energy of particles in a substance.

entity26.name: humidity
entity26.description: The amount of water vapor present in the air.

entity27.name: air currents
entity27.description: Movements of air within the atmosphere, which can be horizontal or vertical.

entity28.name: cloud formation
entity28.description: The process by which clouds are created in the atmosphere through the condensation of water vapor.

entity29.name: cumulus
entity29.description: A type of cloud that is dense and puffy, often resembling cotton balls.

entity30.name: stratus
entity30.description: A type of cloud that forms a uniform layer covering the sky, often resulting in overcast conditions.

entity31.name: cirrus
entity31.description: A type of high-altitude cloud composed of ice crystals, appearing thin and wispy.

entity32.name: Cumulus clouds
entity32.description: Fluffy, white clouds that are often seen on a sunny day.

entity33.name: cumulus clouds
entity33.description: A type of cloud characterized by a puffy, cotton-like appearance, often associated with fair weather but can also develop into storm clouds.

entity34.name: Cumulus clouds
entity34.description: A type of cloud that is typically associated with fair weather, characterized by a puffy, cotton-like appearance.

entity35.name: cumulonimbus clouds
entity35.description: A type of cloud that can develop from cumulus clouds and is associated with thunderstorms and heavy rain, characterized by a large vertical development.

entity36.name: Stratus clouds
entity36.description: Low-lying clouds that form in a more uniform layer across the sky.

entity37.name: Stratus clouds
entity37.description: A type of cloud characterized by a uniform, grayish appearance that often covers the entire sky and can lead to overcast conditions.

entity38.name: Cirrus clouds
entity38.description: High, wispy clouds that are thin and delicate in appearance.

entity39.name: Cirrus clouds
entity39.description: A type of cloud composed of ice crystals, often seen in the sky on clear days.

entity40.name: ice crystals
entity40.description: Small, solid pieces of water that form under cold conditions and are a component of cirrus clouds.

entity41.name: mare's tails
entity41.description: A term used to describe a type of cloud formation known for its wispy, hair-like appearance.

entity42.name: clouds
entity42.description: Visible masses of condensed water vapor floating in the atmosphere, typically white or gray.

entity43.name: condensation
entity43.description: The process by which a substance changes from a gas to a liquid; in meteorology, it refers to water vapor turning into liquid droplets or ice crystals.

entity44.name: water vapor
entity44.description: The gaseous state of water, which is a key component in the Earth's atmosphere and plays a significant role in weather and climate processes.

entity45.name: Temperature
entity45.description: A measure of the average kinetic energy of particles in a substance.

entity46.name: Humidity
entity46.description: The amount of water vapor present in the air.

entity47.name: Air Currents
entity47.description: Movements of air within the atmosphere, which can be horizontal or vertical.

entity48.name: Cloud Formation
entity48.description: The process by which clouds are created in the atmosphere through the condensation of water vapor.

entity49.name: clouds
entity49.description: Visible masses of water droplets or frozen crystals suspended in the atmosphere above the surface of a planetary body.

entity50.name: natural world
entity50.description: The physical world, including plants, animals, landscapes, and ecosystems, as opposed to human-made environments.
